result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Activity:  Arraingment  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

01:25 PM Defendant Benjamin M. White in court by phone with attorney Scott K. Mccarthy by video.  David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.    Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.  Defendant must sign bond June 21, 2022.

Reading waived.    Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.
